name: agent-media
title: Agent Media
description: A dcterms:Agent as content in a dwc:Media entity.
examples: `a person shown in a photograph`; `a group of people in a video`

fields.name: mediaID
fields.title: Media ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: agentID
fields.title: Agent ID
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: subjectCategory
fields.title: Subject Category
fields.description: A category for the content of a dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: subjectCategoryIRI
fields.title: Subject Category IRI
fields.description: An IRI of a controlled vocabulary value for the subject category of a dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: subjectCategorySource
fields.title: Subject Category Source
fields.description: A reference to a controlled vocabulary in which the definition of a value in dwc:subjectCategory is given.
fields.comments: The Audiovisual Core recommended vocabularies do not need to be cited here. There is no required linkage between individual Subject Category terms and the vocabulary; the mechanism is intended to support discovery of the normative URI for a term, but not guarantee it.
fields.rdfs:comment: Any vocabulary or formal classification from which terms in the Subject Category have been drawn.

fields.name: subjectPartLiteral
fields.title: Subject Part Literal
fields.description: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the dwc:Media resource, denoted by a controlled value string.
fields.comments: Values SHOULD be selected from the Controlled Vocabulary for ac:subjectPart. It is best practice to use ac:subjectPart instead of ac:subjectPartLiteral whenever practical.
fields.rdfs:comment: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the media resource, denoted by a controlled value string.

fields.name: subjectPart
fields.title: Subject Part
fields.description: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the dwc:Media resource, denoted by an IRI.
fields.rdfs:comment: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the media resource, denoted by an IRI.

fields.name: subjectOrientationLiteral
fields.title: Subject Orientation Literal
fields.description: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the dwc:Media resource with respect to the acquisition device, denoted by a controlled value string.
fields.comments: Values SHOULD be selected from the Controlled Vocabulary for ac:subjectOrientation. It is best practice to use ac:subjectOrientation instead of ac:subjectOrientationLiteral whenever practical.
fields.rdfs:comment: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the media resource with respect to the acquisition device, denoted by a controlled value string.

fields.name: subjectOrientation
fields.title: Subject Orientation
fields.description: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the dwc:Media resource with respect to the acquisition device.
fields.rdfs:comment: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the media resource with respect to the acquisition device, denoted by a controlled value string.

fields.name: physicalSetting
fields.title: Physical Setting
fields.description: The setting of the content represented in a dwc:Media resource, such as images, sounds, and movies if the provider deems them relevant.
fields.rdfs:comment: The setting of the content represented in a dwc:Media resource, such as images, sounds, and movies if the provider deems them relevant. Constrained vocabulary of: `Natural` = Object in its natural setting of the object (e. g. living organisms in their natural environment); `Artificial` = Object in an artificial environment (e. g. living organisms in an artificial environment such as a zoo, garden, greenhouse, or laboratory); `Edited` = Human media editing of a natural setting or media acquisition with a separate media background such as a photographic backdrop.
